clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Mobile APP Intervention ( iCKD APP) on Chronic Kidney Disease Care
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Mobile APP Intervention ( iCKD APP) on Chronic Kidney Disease Care: A Multicenter, Randomized, Open, Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

brief_summary.textblock:
- Apply Mobile APP Intervention ( iCKD APP) to current chronic kidney disease care program.
- Conduct a randomized clinical trial to evaluate the clinical effectiveness of this mobile device on health behavior improvement in chronic kidney disease patients.

detailed_description.textblock: A mHealth app (iCKD APP) was designed to assist CKD patients to monitor their home bio-information data. Patients will be randomly assigned into the iCKD APP group(intervention) and traditional care group (control). Participants will be randomized into an 1:1 manner (intervention : control). Random assignment occurred after the consent and initial enrollment interview. Individuals randomized to the iCKD APP will provide with the equipment after randomization. Participants will follow for at least 6 months before the exit interview.

primary_outcome.measure: Compare clinics and home blood pressure
primary_outcome.description: Systolic and diastolic blood pressure levels measured at both clinics and home will be compared between and within groups at various time points in study period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Achievement of Blood pressure control target
secondary_outcome.description: Achievement of Blood pressure control target will be compared between and within groups at various time points in study period.

secondary_outcome.measure: The monitor rate of Home Blood pressure
secondary_outcome.description: The monitor rate of Blood pressure at home will be compared between and within groups at various time points in study period.

intervention.description: Use iCKD APP to upload home bio-information data

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects are 20 years old and above, Chinese speaking, and able and willing to provide informed consent.
- Subjects own mobile devices such as cell phones and tablets.
- Subjects were diagnosed with Chronic Kidney Diseases and were taking a single antihypertensive agent for more than three months or they are not receiving treatment but with systolic blood pressure ≥140 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure ≥90 mmHg.
Exclusion Criteria:
- starting dialysis or having a kidney transplant (RRT)
- participating in other interventional study
- cognitively impaired
- unable to give consent
- life expectancy less than 1 year
